description.aboutBMI_text: Quetelet II index – a coefficient created by dividing body weight in kilograms by the square of height in meters. To assess the correct development of a child, centile charts are used, which should be adapted to a given population. Determining the body mass index is important in assessing the risk of diseases related to overweight and obesity, e.g. diabetes, ischemic heart disease, atherosclerosis. It is assumed that a higher BMI is associated with an increased risk to health and life.
